intro: Crepidorhopalon latibracteatus subsp. parviflorus, commonly known as the narrow-bract crepidorhopalon, is a flowering plant characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow bracts. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is native to specific regions in Africa. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are usually pale pink to white, contributing to its ornamental value in horticultural settings.
